entries.content: Start calls by asking for a small amount of time or permission, like 'Do you have 30 seconds to hear why I'm calling?'
Upon gaining attention, clearly and concisely state your value proposition without waffling.
Use open-ended questions immediately after the value statement to uncover needs or challenges.
When handling objections, first acknowledge the prospect's statement ('That's great to hear') before attempting to pivot.
Maintain a confident tone of voice, speak clearly, and avoid rushing to project certainty.
entries.notes: Tone and delivery are part of the technique.
